EECE435L - School Management System
  • Lab 3
  • part2_final module

part2_final module

School Management System GUI (Tkinter)

This module contains a Tkinter-based GUI for managing students, instructors, and courses in a school. It allows adding, editing, and deleting records, assigning instructors to courses, registering students for courses, and searching records. It also supports saving and loading the data to/from a JSON file.

Classes:

None

Functions:

get_new_student_id(): Generates a unique student ID. get_new_instructor_id(): Generates a unique instructor ID. get_new_course_id(): Generates a unique course ID. save_data(): Saves the current state of students, instructors, courses,

registrations, and assignments to a JSON file.

load_data(): Loads the state of students, instructors, courses,

registrations, and assignments from a JSON file.

update_treeview(): Updates the treeview display with the current data. update_dropdown_menus(): Updates the dropdown menus for students,

instructors, and courses.

add_student(): Adds a new student based on user input. add_instructor(): Adds a new instructor based on user input. add_course(): Adds a new course based on user input. register_student_for_course(): Registers a selected student for a

selected course.

assign_instructor_to_course(): Assigns a selected instructor to a

selected course.

search_records(search_by, search_term): Searches for students,

instructors, or courses by name, ID, or type.

edit_record(): Edits a selected record (student, instructor, or course). update_record(): Updates a record with the user’s modifications. delete_record(): Deletes a selected record from the system.

part2_final.add_course()[source]

Adds a new course to the system. The course’s name and instructor are provided by the user through entry fields in the GUI. A unique course ID is generated automatically.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If the course name or instructor is missing or invalid.

part2_final.add_instructor()[source]

Adds a new instructor to the system. The instructor’s name, age, and email are provided by the user through entry fields in the GUI. A unique instructor ID is generated automatically.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If any required fields are missing or if the email format is invalid.

part2_final.add_student()[source]

Adds a new student to the system. The student’s name, age, and email are provided by the user through entry fields in the GUI. A unique student ID is generated automatically.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If any required fields are missing or if the email format is invalid.

part2_final.assign_instructor_to_course()[source]

Assigns a selected instructor to a selected course. Both the instructor and course are chosen from dropdown menus in the GUI.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If the instructor or course is missing or invalid.

part2_final.delete_record()[source]

Deletes the currently selected record (student, instructor, or course) from the system.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If no record is selected.

part2_final.edit_record()[source]

Allows the user to edit a selected record (student, instructor, or course). The selected record’s fields are loaded into the relevant entry fields for editing.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If no record is selected.

part2_final.get_new_course_id()[source]

Generates a unique course ID in the format ‘Cxxx’, where ‘xxx’ is a zero-padded number.

Returns:

New unique course ID.

Return type:

str

part2_final.get_new_instructor_id()[source]

Generates a unique instructor ID in the format ‘Ixxx’, where ‘xxx’ is a zero-padded number.

Returns:

New unique instructor ID.

Return type:

str

part2_final.get_new_student_id()[source]

Generates a unique student ID in the format ‘Sxxx’, where ‘xxx’ is a zero-padded number.

Returns:

New unique student ID.

Return type:

str

part2_final.load_data()[source]

Loads the state of the system from a JSON file, updating the global students, instructors, courses, registrations, and assignments variables.

part2_final.register_student_for_course()[source]

Registers a selected student for a selected course. Both the student and course are chosen from dropdown menus in the GUI.

Raises:

  • messagebox.showerror – If the student or course is missing or invalid.

  • messagebox.showinfo – If the student is already registered for the selected course.

part2_final.save_data()[source]

Saves the current state of the system, including students, instructors, courses, registrations, and assignments, to a JSON file.

part2_final.search_records(search_by, search_term)[source]

Searches for students, instructors, or courses by name, ID, or type.

Parameters:

  • search_by (str) – The field to search by (‘Name’, ‘ID’, or ‘Type’).

  • search_term (str) – The search term to match against.

part2_final.update_dropdown_menus()[source]

Updates the dropdown menus with the names of students, instructors, and courses.

part2_final.update_record()[source]

Updates the currently selected record (student, instructor, or course) based on the user’s modifications to the entry fields.

Raises:

messagebox.showerror – If no record is selected for editing.

part2_final.update_treeview()[source]

Updates the treeview display with the current students, instructors, and courses.
